Identification.LongTitle: Qualifications for Designations as Analysts Regulations

Provision.Text: His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Health, pursuant to paragraph 55(1)(o) of the Controlled Drugs and Substances Acta, hereby makes the annexed Qualifications for Designations as Analysts Regulations.

Section.Text: The Minister may, pursuant to section 44 of the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act, designate a person as an analyst if the person has the following qualifications:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a degree in a science related to the work to be carried out, awarded by

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a foreign university recognized by a Canadian university or professional association; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a combination, sufficient to perform the duties of the position, of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: practical experience in the area of responsibility, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: formal education in a science related to the work to be carried out or other training related to that work.

Section.Text: These Regulations come into force on the day on which they are registered.
